definition: Wu Ding (c. 14th century BC), legendary founder and wise ruler of Shang dynasty
martial/military
surname Wu
fourth of the ten Heavenly Stems 十天干[shi2 tian1 gan1]/fourth in order/letter "D" or Roman "IV" in list "A, B, C", or "I, II, III" etc/ancient Chinese compass point: 195°/butyl/cubes (of food)
surname Ding

sentences.english: King Wuding of the Shang Dynasty once lived here with his Prime Minister Fu Yue.
sentences.chinese: 這裏啊曾經居住過商王武丁和他的宰相傅說。

sentences.english: King Wuding appreciated Fu's great talent and bold vision.
sentences.chinese: 武丁特別欣賞傅說的雄才大略。

definition: Fu Hao (c. 1200 BC), or Lady Hao, female Chinese general of the late Shang Dynasty 商朝[Shang1 chao2]
Shang Dynasty (c. 1600-1046 BC)
Di Yi (died 1076 BC), Shang dynasty king, reigned 1101-1076 BC
King Wu of Zhou (-1043), personal name Ji Fa 姬發|姬发, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 1046-1043 BC
King Xuan, eleventh King of Zhou, reigned (828-782 BC)
Emperor Xin, last ruler of Shang (11th Century BC), famous as a tyrant
final name of the Shang dynasty after their move to Yinxu 殷墟 in modern Henan province
King Zhou of Shang (11th century BC), notorious as a cruel tyrant
Xia dynasty, unconfirmed but placed at c. 2070-c. 1600 BC
the Zhou dynasty from 1027 BC
King Wu of Zhou, personal name Ji Fa, reigned 1046-1043 BC as first king of Western Zhou dynasty 西周[Xi1 Zhou1] 1046-771 BC
Zhou Dynasty/Western Zhou 西周 (1046-771 BC) and Eastern Zhou 東周|东周 (770-221 BC)
Western Zhou (1027-771 BC)
Duke Mu of Qin, the first substantial king of Qin (ruled 659-621 BC), sometimes considered one of the Five Hegemons 春秋五霸

King Wen of Zhou state (c. 1152-1056 BC), reigned c. 1099-1056 BC as king of Zhou state, leading figure in building the subsequent Western Zhou dynasty, father of King Wu of Zhou 周武王[Zhou1 Wu3 wang2] the first Zhou dynasty king
Di Ku or Emperor Ku, one of the Five Legendary Emperors 五帝[wu3 di4], great-grandson of the Yellow Emperor 黃帝|黄帝[Huang2 di4]
